jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join our growing Design Team

We’re a fast-growing Series A Construction Scheduling Startup that’s transforming one of the world’s largest industries—and we’re on fire. You’ll own design end-to-end, shaping products that redefine how General Contractors and teams collaborate to build world-class construction schedules. This is a rare chance to set the design vision at a company scaling fast, with the resources of a funded startup and the energy of a rocket ship.

If you’re driven to create elegant, intuitive experiences that make real-world impact—and you want to leave your fingerprints on the future of construction—this is your stage. 🚀

Key Responsibilities:

  • Drive best in class product design to redefine the industry

  • Conduct user interviews and research to uncover insights to drive impactful product updates

  • Own end-to-end design efforts: take concepts and ideas and turn them into polished customer-facing product

  • Partner cross-functionally with Product and Engineering

  • Participate in product roadmap planning and team goal setting

  • Improve and implement a design process that focuses on high quality and efficiency

  • Contribute to improving our Design System

Qualifications:

  • You have 5+ years of experience creating best-in-class product design for SaaS

  • You have a compelling portfolio showcasing the breadth of your experience and the metrics your projects affected

  • You can articulate the rationale behind design decisions

  • You have a proven track record as a designer who can own solving complex user problems

  • You lean on innovation and technological advances to design industry leading solutions

  • You can design within an iterative process while working with your product manager and engineering partners to achieve a vision

  • You have the ability to think about product as a system, driving different features to work holistically to achieve a goal

  • You take pride in creating and maintaining excellent design standards, as well as championing design best practices

  • You boldly embrace AI tools to help drive design efficiencies and excellence

  • You have excellent written, verbal, and storytelling skills

  • You're excited about teaching, learning, and working collaboratively across teams

  • You have a strong point of view and like to voice your opinions, but are eager to change them based on data

  • You have a proven track record working on remote teams

  • You take pride in creating and maintaining excellent design standards, as well as championing design best practices

  • You have excellent written, verbal, and storytelling skills

  • You're excited about teaching, learning, and working collaboratively across teams

  • You have a strong point of view and like to voice your opinions, but are eager to change them based on data

jobs.title: Regional Sales Manager (SoCal)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Planera is a fast-growing software startup revolutionizing construction planning and scheduling. We are disrupting an industry that has seen little innovation in decades, and the opportunity for change – and upside – is big. Our culture is dynamic, smart, and spirited, and we are committed to solving critical problems for general contractors and project owners. Join us and help to grow a company that will change how the world is built.

Position Overview:

We're looking for a motivated seller with a value based approach to join our sales team. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of SaaS sales experience. This is a mission-critical hire that will play a pivotal role in securing long-term success by providing construction builders with the best planning and scheduling platform for their stakeholders in your specific region. This role will report to our Head of Sales and has the opportunity to work remotely within their strategic market. Candidate must have experience in Construction Tech and be familiar with construction workflows.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prospect and develop new potential accounts within our ideal customer profile by educating contacts about how they can impact their business with an easy to use, collaborative, and robust planning platform.

  • Own your market: Hold face-to-face and Zoom meetings with prospective customers to understand their business challenges and goals.

  • Product: Run product demos based on the needs of customers. Leverage Solutions Engineering for tailored demonstrations.

  • Win Together: Meet and exceed your quota goals as a team.

  • Value selling: Ability to sell to multiple stakeholders, selling against competitors, negotiating, presenting, and closing with value.

  • Customer Focus: Liaise with our sales engineer and customer success teams to provide world class customer experience.

  • Cross-Functional: Work collaboratively with solutions engineering, customer success, and business development to deliver great customer outcomes and results.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of full cycle SaaS software sales; proven experience identifying and closing strategic contracts

  • Startup Experience: Ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment with a builders mentality who thrives in collaborative environments

  • Prospecting: Hunter mindset, results-driven, and proactive in building new business pipeline

  • Proven Success: A track record of high achievement in current and previous roles exceeding quotas without sacrificing values

  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to uncover and articulate/present business value clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Curiosity: A perfect mix of curiosity, ambition, openness, resilience, and optimism along with a value-added mindset

  • Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, particularly solutions engineering and customer success.

Why Join Us:

  • Impact: Be at the forefront of transforming a $12.1 trillion industry. Make a meaningful impact on how the world builds.

  • Culture: Join a smart, spirited team dedicated to innovation and excellence.

  • Growth: Opportunity for professional growth and career advancement in a fast-paced start-up environment.

Benefits: Competitive salary, stock options, benefits package, and a dynamic work environment.

jobs.title: Frontend Software Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

Help us build intuitive interfaces for complex construction workflows. Create sophisticated scheduling visualizations, resource management tools, and reporting features that help construction teams manage multi-million dollar projects.

Key Responsibilities

  • Apply modern development practices while using an AI-first methodology

  • Build interactive CPM network diagrams and resource visualizations

  • Create data-rich dashboards and reporting interfaces

  • Implement PDF generation for construction documents

  • Optimize performance for projects with thousands of activities

  • Write comprehensive tests and participate in code reviews

Requirements

  • 3-4 years frontend development experience

  • Strong React and TypeScript skills

  • Experience with complex, data-intensive applications

  • Treats comprehensive testing as non-negotiable for feature completion

  • Self-motivated remote worker with excellent communication

Preferred

  • Experience with DHTMLX or similar Gantt chart libraries

  • Construction tech or project management software experience

  • Data visualization experience (D3.js, Chart.js)

  • AG-Grid or enterprise data grid knowledge

  • Performance optimization for large datasets

Tech Stack

React, TypeScript, DHTMLX Gantt, PandaCSS, TanStack Query, AG-Grid, Vitest, GitLab

jobs.title: AI Product Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

Join Planera to build AI-powered agentic workflows that transform construction planning and scheduling. You'll design intelligent automation systems, conversational interfaces, and autonomous agents that help construction teams work more efficiently. This is a product engineering role focused on developing practical AI solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and implement agentic AI workflows for construction automation

  • Build intelligent agents for scheduling, resource allocation, and project optimization

  • Develop conversational interfaces and prompt engineering solutions

  • Create robust backend services in Python/Golang to support AI features

  • Integrate LLMs and AI APIs into construction workflows

  • Build scalable APIs for complex construction project data

  • Collaborate with frontend team to deliver seamless AI experiences

Requirements

  • 4+ years full-stack development (backend-focused)

  • Strong proficiency in Python and/or Golang (Node.js is a plus)

  • Experience with LLMs, prompt engineering, and AI APIs

  • Understanding of agentic systems and workflow automation

  • Detailed knowledge of agent frameworks like Langchain

  • Experience building conversational AI or chatbots

  • Have deployed agentic chat systems to production

  • Strong API design and database skills (SQL/NoSQL)

  • Cloud platform experience (AWS/GCP/Azure)

  • React knowledge for frontend integration

  • Product mindset with focus on user outcomes

  • Excellent remote communication skills

Preferred

  • Construction tech or project management software experience

  • Knowledge of RAG systems and vector databases

  • Experience with workflow orchestration tools

  • Understanding of construction industry workflows

Tech Stack

Python, Golang, React, PostgreSQL, AWS/GCP, Docker, GitLab, Datadog

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Planera is a fast-growing software startup revolutionizing construction planning and scheduling. We are disrupting an industry that has seen little innovation in decades, and the opportunity for change – and upside – is big. Our culture is dynamic, smart, and spirited, and we are committed to solving critical problems for general contractors and project owners. Join us and help to grow a company that will change how the world is built.

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced and driven Senior Product Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of SaaS product management experience, and he or she will work closely with our design, engineering and GTM team to create and execute on the company's roadmap. This role reports directly to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO). Candidate must have experience in Construction Tech product management and be familiar with construction workflows.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Product Strategy: Develop and drive the product roadmap in alignment with company goals, market trends, and customer needs within the construction tech space.

  • Customer Focus: Engage directly with customers to understand their pain points, workflows, and requirements, translating these insights into actionable product features.

  • UX Design: Collaborate closely with UX/UI designers to ensure the product offers an exceptional user experience, balancing functionality with ease of use.

  • Market Research: Stay ahead of industry trends, competitor offerings, and technological advancements to ensure our product remains competitive and innovative.

  • Cross-Functional Leadership: Work collaboratively with engineering, sales, marketing, and support teams to deliver high-quality products on time and within budget.

  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Utilize analytics, user feedback, and other data sources to inform product decisions and prioritize features that deliver maximum value.

  • Go-To-Market: Partner with marketing and sales teams to develop effective go-to-market strategies, including product positioning, messaging, and launch plans.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of product management experience, with a significant portion in the construction technology sector.

  • UX Focus: Demonstrated ability to design and deliver products with a strong focus on user experience and customer satisfaction.

  • Customer Engagement: Proven track record of engaging with customers to gather insights and feedback, and translating that into successful product features.

  • Leadership: Strong leadership and cross-functional team collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and drive decision-making across all levels of the organization.

  • Technical Acumen: Solid understanding of construction workflows, software development processes, and technology trends in the construction industry.

  • Analytical Skills: Proficient in using data and metrics to drive product decisions, with a focus on delivering measurable results.

  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, particularly sales and engineering.

Innovation: A creative thinker with a passion for innovation and staying ahead of industry trends.

Why Join Us:

  • Impact: Be at the forefront of transforming a $12.1 trillion industry. Make a meaningful impact on how the world builds.

  • Culture: Join a smart, spirited team dedicated to innovation and excellence.

  • Growth: Opportunity for professional growth and career advancement in a fast-paced start-up environment.

  • Benefits: Competitive salary, stock options, benefits package, and a dynamic work environment.

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Remote

Reports to: Head of Marketing

About Planera

At Planera, we’re revolutionizing construction scheduling with powerful, easy, collaborative software. Our platform empowers field and office teams with a seamless, visual way to plan, communicate, and execute with confidence. As we scale into the ENR Top 400 General Contractors and beyond, personalized engagement with strategic accounts is more important than ever.

We’re looking for a Growth Marketing Manager who’s passionate about connecting the dots between marketing strategy, sales alignment, and customer value in the construction tech space. If you’re excited by the challenge of engaging deeply with our most important accounts and helping construction leaders rethink how they plan and schedule, we want to hear from you.

What You’ll Be Doing

As the Marketing Manager, you will be primarily focused on Growth marketing, Account-Based Marketing, and Demand Generation. You will be responsible for developing and executing highly targeted marketing strategies to drive engagement and pipeline growth within Planera’s most strategic accounts. You’ll work hand-in-hand with Regional Sales Managers, Customer Success, and the Marketing team to build custom programs that resonate with our ideal customer profiles — from project managers and superintendents to executives.

This is a strategic and hands-on role that spans campaign development, content personalization, field events, social media, and sales enablement.

Key Responsibilities

  • Campaign Execution:
    Orchestrate multi-channel campaigns including email, personalized content, field events, social media, and digital ads designed to influence buying committees within target accounts.

  • Strategic ABM Planning:
    Build and execute tailored marketing programs that align with account-level sales objectives and Planera’s revenue goals.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration:
    Partner with RSMs and CS leaders to identify priority accounts, gather insights, and define success metrics across the full customer lifecycle.

  • Data-Driven Optimization:
    Leverage CRM and marketing automation tools to measure campaign performance, iterate strategies, and report on ROI.

  • AI-Driven Personalization:
    Leverage the latest AI tools and insights to scale personalization across target accounts, accelerating segmentation, content development, and intent-driven engagement strategies.

  • Industry-Relevant Messaging:
    Craft compelling, account-specific content that speaks directly to the unique challenges of construction professionals in areas like scheduling, labor planning, and field execution.

  • Event Activation:
    Collaborate on conferences, regional field events, and executive roundtables targeted at key decision-makers within our top accounts.

  • Stakeholder Engagement:
    Build trust and maintain strong working relationships with both internal teams and external stakeholders at key accounts.

  • Trend Analysis & Market Intelligence:
    Stay attuned to construction tech trends, major GC shifts, and competitor activities to inform marketing efforts.

What We’re Looking For

  • 5 years in B2B marketing with 2+ years focused on growth marketing, ABM and/or Demand Generation, ideally in high-growth SaaS or vertical-specific industries like construction tech.

  • Proven ability to design and scale personalized marketing programs that drive revenue impact.

  • Strong understanding of complex B2B sales cycles and the dynamics of cross-functional GTM teams.

  • Familiarity with tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, Apollo, LinkedIn, and AI/ABM platforms.

  • Strong writing skills and the ability to turn technical value props into compelling narratives.

  • Creative, scrappy, and comfortable in a fast-paced, startup culture.

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related field.

  • Bonus: Experience marketing to construction professionals or working with GTM teams targeting ENR Top 400 GCs.

We’re looking for a Growth Marketing Manager who’s passionate about connecting the dots between marketing strategy, sales alignment, and customer value in the construction tech space. If you’re excited by the challenge of engaging deeply with our most important accounts and helping construction leaders rethink how they plan and schedule, we want to hear from you.


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

As the Marketing Manager, you will be primarily focused on Growth marketing, Account-Based Marketing, and Demand Generation. You will be responsible for developing and executing highly targeted marketing strategies to drive engagement and pipeline growth within Planera’s most strategic accounts. You’ll work hand-in-hand with Regional Sales Managers, Customer Success, and the Marketing team to build custom programs that resonate with our ideal customer profiles — from project managers and superintendents to executives.

This is a strategic and hands-on role that spans campaign development, content personalization, field events, social media, and sales enablement.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Campaign Execution:
   Orchestrate multi-channel campaigns including email, personalized content, field events, social media, and digital ads designed to influence buying committees within target accounts.

 - Strategic ABM Planning:
   Build and execute tailored marketing programs that align with account-level sales objectives and Planera’s revenue goals.

 - Cross-Functional Collaboration:
   Partner with RSMs and CS leaders to identify priority accounts, gather insights, and define success metrics across the full customer lifecycle.

 - Data-Driven Optimization:
   Leverage CRM and marketing automation tools to measure campaign performance, iterate strategies, and report on ROI.

 - AI-Driven Personalization:
   Leverage the latest AI tools and insights to scale personalization across target accounts, accelerating segmentation, content development, and intent-driven engagement strategies.

 - Industry-Relevant Messaging:
   Craft compelling, account-specific content that speaks directly to the unique challenges of construction professionals in areas like scheduling, labor planning, and field execution.

 - Event Activation:
   Collaborate on conferences, regional field events, and executive roundtables targeted at key decision-makers within our top accounts.

 - Stakeholder Engagement:
   Build trust and maintain strong working relationships with both internal teams and external stakeholders at key accounts.

 - Trend Analysis & Market Intelligence:
   Stay attuned to construction tech trends, major GC shifts, and competitor activities to inform marketing efforts.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - 5 years in B2B marketing with 2+ years focused on growth marketing, ABM and/or Demand Generation, ideally in high-growth SaaS or vertical-specific industries like construction tech.

 - Proven ability to design and scale personalized marketing programs that drive revenue impact.

 - Strong understanding of complex B2B sales cycles and the dynamics of cross-functional GTM teams.

 - Familiarity with tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, Apollo, LinkedIn, and AI/ABM platforms.

 - Strong writing skills and the ability to turn technical value props into compelling narratives.

 - Creative, scrappy, and comfortable in a fast-paced, startup culture.

 - Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related field.

 - Bonus: Experience marketing to construction professionals or working with GTM teams targeting ENR Top 400 GCs.

jobs.title: Sales Leader: East Coast
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Planera is a fast-growing software startup revolutionizing construction planning and scheduling. We are disrupting an industry that has seen little innovation in decades, and the opportunity for change – and upside – is big. Our culture is dynamic, smart, and spirited, and we are committed to solving critical problems for general contractors and project owners. Join us and help to grow a company that will change how the world is built.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for a foundational frontline sales leader to join our East Coast team. This is not a “behind the desk” management role — it’s a builder position for someone who thrives in the field with sellers, leads from the front, and can help us scale into the future.

You’ll be responsible for coaching, enabling, and developing our sales team while also rolling up your sleeves to be directly involved in high-value deals. If you’re passionate about value-based selling, energized by growth, and ready to make an immediate impact, this is your chance to help shape the trajectory of a category-defining company.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead, coach, and develop a team of sellers.

  • Be actively involved in high-priority deals — from strategy to execution.

  • Model value-based selling and help the team adopt best practices in discovery, qualification, and closing.

  • Partner with marketing, customer success, and product to ensure a seamless buyer experience.

  • Build the systems, processes, and culture needed to scale the sales organization.

  • Track team performance and implement strategies to drive pipeline growth and revenue.

  • Recruit and onboard top talent as we expand the team.

What We’re Looking For

  • Proven frontline sales leadership experience in a high-growth B2B SaaS environment.

  • A builder’s mindset — excited to create new processes, playbooks, and team structures.

  • Strong track record of value-based selling to executive-level buyers.

  • Comfortable being hands-on in deals while coaching and developing others.

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment.

  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills.

  • Passion, perseverance, and a sense of fun.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

  • 🔥 World-class leadership with a track record of scaling sales teams.

  • 📈 Exceptional growth metrics and a huge, underserved market opportunity.

  • 😊 Happy customers who love our product.

  • 🎯 A must-have solution solving mission-critical problems.

  • 🎉 Fun, driven team culture that celebrates wins and supports each other.

  • 💡 Fantastic investors who believe in our vision.

Ready to lead from the front and help us build the future of planning and scheduling?
Apply today and let’s shape the next chapter of Planera together.

Why Join Us:

  • Impact: Be at the forefront of transforming a $12.1 trillion industry. Make a meaningful impact on how the world builds.

  • Culture: Join a smart, spirited team dedicated to innovation and excellence.

  • Growth: Opportunity for professional growth and career advancement in a fast-paced start-up environment.

  • Benefits: Competitive salary, stock options, benefits package, and a dynamic work environment.

jobs.title: Technical Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location

We are hiring multiple Remote positions.

  • West (California)

  • Central (Texas, Midwest, Mountain states)

  • East

Ideally candidates are located near a major airport as this will require up to 30% travel.

Role

As a Technical Customer Success Manager, you’ll be the strategic partner for our customers, ensuring they maximize the value of Planera’s platform. You will take ownership of the entire customer lifecycle—from onboarding and adoption to retention and expansion. Your ability to blend construction scheduling expertise with exceptional customer relationship management will be key in driving customer success.

This role is highly technical, requiring hands-on experience with CPM scheduling software and a deep understanding of construction project management workflows. You’ll work closely with customers to help them optimize their scheduling process, manage pilot projects and proof of concepts (POCs), and provide strategic guidance on best practices.

Additionally, you will collaborate cross-functionally with sales, product, and engineering teams to ensure that customer feedback is translated into continuous product improvements.

Key Responsibilities

Customer Onboarding & Adoption – Lead hands-on onboarding sessions, ensuring customers are set up for success with Planera from day one

  • Customer Relationship Management – Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to drive engagement and long-term retention.

  • Technical Guidance & Training – Provide expert-level guidance on construction scheduling best practices, particularly for users transitioning from tools like Oracle Primavera P6 or Microsoft Project.

  • Pilot & POC Management – Support and manage customer pilots and proof-of-concepts, helping organizations evaluate Planera’s value.

  • Customer Retention & Expansion – Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities, collaborating with the sales team to drive expansion.

  • Customer Advocacy & Feedback Loop – Act as the voice of the customer, relaying insights and feature requests to product and engineering teams.

  • Support & Troubleshooting – Assist customers with technical issues, working alongside product and engineering teams to resolve challenges quickly.

  • Data-Driven Insights – Analyze customer usage and engagement data to proactively identify risks and opportunities for improvement.

What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience in construction project management in a Project Manager (PM), Superintendent, or Project Engineer (PE) role.

  • In-depth knowledge of CPM scheduling and construction workflows.

  • Hands-on experience with CPM scheduling tools (Oracle Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, or similar).

  • Knowledge and experience with data center construction is a plus.

  • Proven ability to drive customer satisfaction, retention, and expansion.

  • Experience managing customer pilots and proof-of-concepts (POCs).

  • Ability to troubleshoot technical issues and provide clear, actionable solutions.

  • Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in Construction Management or Civil Engineering.

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills – ability to communicate complex ideas simply.

  • Strong relationship-building skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
    Ability to work independently in a remote setting while collaborating across teams.

  • Expect up to 30% travel

Why Join Planera?

  • Be part of a fast-growing startup that’s transforming construction industry

  • Shape the future of our platform by working closely with product and engineering teams.
    Remote-first culture with flexibility and autonomy.

  • Incredible leadership team with proven success record in the startups.

  • Competitive salary, benefits, and potential for growth within the company.

  • Apply today!

About Us

Planera, Inc. is transforming how construction professionals plan and schedule their projects. Our collaborative online whiteboard-based CPM scheduling software simplifies project scheduling, eliminating inefficiencies and reducing the time required to create resource- and cost-loaded schedules. With built-in risk simulation and schedule quality checking, we remove the need for third-party plug-ins, making scheduling smarter, faster, and more intuitive.

At Planera, we believe in delivering powerful yet user-friendly solutions that drive project profitability. Join us in revolutionizing the construction tech space!
